items.title: Clintons agree to testify on Epstein as vote looms to hold them in contempt of Congress
items.standfirst: The couple bows to the House Oversight Committee's demands after arguing for months that its subpoenas were invalid.
items.content: The couple bows to the House Oversight Committee's demands after arguing for months that its subpoenas were invalid.

items.title: Bill and Hillary Clinton to testify before Congress in Epstein probe
items.standfirst: Former US President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton will testify in a congressional investigation into the late financier Jeffrey Epstein, a staffer said on Monday. The move could avert a Republican-led House vote to hold the two Democrats in contempt of Congress, potentially exposing them to criminal charges.
items.content: Former US President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton will testify in a congressional investigation into the late financier Jeffrey Epstein, a staffer said on Monday. The move could avert a Republican-led House vote to hold the two Democrats in contempt of Congress, potentially exposing them to criminal charges.

items.title: Former Prince Andrew should testify before Congress, U.K.'s Keir Starmer says as Epstein revelations mount
items.standfirst: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has called on the former Prince Andrew to testify before Congress about his dealings with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
items.content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has called on the former Prince Andrew to testify before Congress about his dealings with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

clusters.title: Trickle of Palestinians get to leave, enter Gaza as Rafah crossing reopens
clusters.neutral_headline: Trickle of Palestinians get to leave, enter Gaza as Rafah crossing reopens
bullet_summary: However, by nightfall, Reuters reported that Israel had permitted 12 Palestinians to re-enter the territory, according to Palestinian and Egyptian sources
A further 38 had not cleared security and would wait on the Egyptian side of the crossing overnight, it said
Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt has reopened to a limited amount of foot traffic, an Israeli security official said Monday
An Egyptian official said that 50 Palestinians would cross in each direction on the first day of the crossing's reopening

items.title: Trickle of Palestinians get to leave, enter Gaza as Rafah crossing reopens
items.standfirst: Only 12 Palestinians entered Gaza through Rafah while five patients and their escorts were allowed to leave for Egypt.
items.content: Only 12 Palestinians entered Gaza through Rafah while five patients and their escorts were allowed to leave for Egypt.

items.title: Handful of sick and wounded Palestinians allowed through Rafah crossing on first day
items.standfirst: Numbers Israel permitted to enter Egypt after reopening border were far lower than expected following delaysA small number of sick and wounded Palestinians have begun crossing into Egypt to seek medical treatment after Israel permitted a limited reopening of the Palestinian territory’s Rafah border post as fragile diplomatic efforts to stabilise the conflict inch forward.About 150 people were due to leave the territory on Monday, and 50 to enter it, according to Egyptian officials, more than 20 months after Israeli forces closed the crossing. However, by nightfall, Reuters reported that Israel had permitted 12 Palestinians to re-enter the territory, according to Palestinian and Egyptian sources. A further 38 had not cleared security and would wait on the Egyptian side of the crossing overnight, it said. Continue reading...
items.content: Numbers Israel permitted to enter Egypt after reopening border were far lower than expected following delaysA small number of sick and wounded Palestinians have begun crossing into Egypt to seek medical treatment after Israel permitted a limited reopening of the Palestinian territory’s Rafah border post as fragile diplomatic efforts to stabilise the conflict inch forward.About 150 people were due to leave the territory on Monday, and 50 to enter it, according to Egyptian officials, more than 20 months after Israeli forces closed the crossing. However, by nightfall, Reuters reported that Israel had permitted 12 Palestinians to re-enter the territory, according to Palestinian and Egyptian sources. A further 38 had not cleared security and would wait on the Egyptian side of the crossing overnight, it said. Continue reading...

items.title: Relief for patients leaving Gaza as Rafah opens, but thousands still wait
items.standfirst: Israeli restrictions mean only five Palestinians allowed to leave Gaza for treatment via Rafah crossing on first day.
items.content: Israeli restrictions mean only five Palestinians allowed to leave Gaza for treatment via Rafah crossing on first day.

items.standfirst: The Rafah border crossing is once again operational as part of the US-brokered 'ceasefire'.
items.content: The Rafah border crossing is once again operational as part of the US-brokered 'ceasefire'.

items.title: Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt has reopened in both directions for Palestinians
items.standfirst: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt has reopened to a limited amount of foot traffic, an Israeli security official said Monday. An Egyptian official said that 50 Palestinians would cross in each direction on the first day of the crossing's reopening.
items.content: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt has reopened to a limited amount of foot traffic, an Israeli security official said Monday. An Egyptian official said that 50 Palestinians would cross in each direction on the first day of the crossing's reopening.

items.title: Key Gaza border crossing reopens, a step forward in the Israel-Hamas ceasefire
items.standfirst: The Rafah border crossing between the Gaza Strip and Egypt partially reopened Monday, a significant step in the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas
items.content: The Rafah border crossing between the Gaza Strip and Egypt partially reopened Monday, a significant step in the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas

items.title: Gaza’s Rafah crossing to reopen for Palestinians on Monday, Israel says
items.standfirst: Officials say Gaza residents travelling on foot only will be allowed through border point, which was shut in May 2024Gaza’s main border crossing in Rafah will reopen for Palestinians on Monday, Israel has said, with preparations under way at the war-ravaged territory’s gateway, which has been mostly closed for almost two years.Before the war, the Rafah crossing with Egypt was the only direct exit point for most Palestinians in Gaza to reach the outside world as well as a key entry point for aid. It has been largely shut since May 2024. Continue reading...
items.content: Officials say Gaza residents travelling on foot only will be allowed through border point, which was shut in May 2024Gaza’s main border crossing in Rafah will reopen for Palestinians on Monday, Israel has said, with preparations under way at the war-ravaged territory’s gateway, which has been mostly closed for almost two years.Before the war, the Rafah crossing with Egypt was the only direct exit point for most Palestinians in Gaza to reach the outside world as well as a key entry point for aid. It has been largely shut since May 2024. Continue reading...

items.title: Judge blocks Trump administration from ending protections for Haitians
items.standfirst: A federal judge on Monday blocked the end of protections that have allowed roughly 350,000 Haitians to live in the U.S., dealing President Donald Trump's immigration agenda another legal setback.
items.content: A federal judge on Monday blocked the end of protections that have allowed roughly 350,000 Haitians to live in the U.S., dealing President Donald Trump's immigration agenda another legal setback.(Image credit: Luis Andres Henao)

items.title: US judge temporarily blocks lifting of deportation protections for Haiti migrants
items.standfirst: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration's attempt to end deportation protections for more than 350,000 Haitian immigrants, who are allowed to live and work in the US legally under Temporary Protected Status (TPS). A day before the TPS was set to lapse, US judge Ana Reyes…

A day before the TPS was set to lapse, US judge Ana Reyes…

items.title: Judge blocks DHS from ending deportation protections for 350,000 Haitians
items.standfirst: A federal judge on Monday blocked the Trump administration from revoking Temporary Protected Status for Haitians, granting a last-minute reprieve to 350,000 immigrants who were set to lose protections on Tuesday.
items.content: A federal judge on Monday blocked the Trump administration from revoking Temporary Protected Status for Haitians, granting a last-minute reprieve to 350,000 immigrants who were set to lose protections on Tuesday.

items.title: Judge blocks Trump administration’s stripping of Haitians’ protected status
items.standfirst: Up to 350,000 Haitians legally live and work in the US due to being granted temporary protected statusA federal judge has blocked the Trump administration from stripping temporary protected status from up to 350,000 Haitians, a status that allows them to legally live and work in the United States amid the turmoil in their homeland.Judge Ana Reyes issued a temporary stay that prevents Kristi Noem, the US homeland security secretary, from implementing her decision to remove the status known as TPS, which was scheduled to expire on Tuesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Up to 350,000 Haitians legally live and work in the US due to being granted temporary protected statusA federal judge has blocked the Trump administration from stripping temporary protected status from up to 350,000 Haitians, a status that allows them to legally live and work in the United States amid the turmoil in their homeland.Judge Ana Reyes issued a temporary stay that prevents Kristi Noem, the US homeland security secretary, from implementing her decision to remove the status known as TPS, which was scheduled to expire on Tuesday. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump cuts India tariffs after Modi agrees to stop Russia oil purchases
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on Monday he had struck a trade deal with India to cut tariffs after Prime Minister Narendra Modi pledged to halt purchases of Russia oil over the war in Ukraine. He said levies on Indian goods would fall to 18% from 25% under the agreement.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Monday he had struck a trade deal with India to cut tariffs after Prime Minister Narendra Modi pledged to halt purchases of Russia oil over the war in Ukraine. He said levies on Indian goods would fall to 18% from 25% under the agreement.

items.title: US and India reach trade deal, Trump says after Modi call
items.standfirst: Tariffs will drop from 50% to 18% on Indian goods, while India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil.
items.content: Tariffs will drop from 50% to 18% on Indian goods, while India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil.

items.title: Trump cuts India tariffs to 18% as Modi agrees to stop buying Russian oil
items.standfirst: US president had slapped India with a punitive 25% tariff for buying Russian oil on top of a 25% 'reciprocal' tariff.
items.content: US president had slapped India with a punitive 25% tariff for buying Russian oil on top of a 25% 'reciprocal' tariff.

clusters.title: Elon Musk merges SpaceX with xAI at $1.25tn valuation
clusters.neutral_headline: Elon Musk merges SpaceX with xAI at $1.25tn valuation
bullet_summary: The deal gives SpaceX a valuation of $1 trillion, and xAI a value of $250 billion, people familiar with the matter said
The two companies announced the deal on Monday in a statement on…

items.title: Elon Musk merges SpaceX with xAI at $1.25tn valuation
items.standfirst: Aerospace business and artificial intelligence firm to unite for IPO as world’s most valuable private companyBusiness live – latest updatesElon Musk’s aerospace company SpaceX has acquired his artificial intelligence business xAI, in a $1.25tn (£910bn) merger that consolidates part of Musk’s empire as SpaceX prepares to go public later this year.The two companies announced the deal on Monday in a statement on SpaceX’s website, saying the merger would form “the most ambitious, vertically-integrated innovation engine on (and off) Earth, with AI, rockets, space-based internet, direct-to-mobile device communications and the world’s foremost real-time information and free speech platform”. Continue reading...
items.content: Aerospace business and artificial intelligence firm to unite for IPO as world’s most valuable private companyBusiness live – latest updatesElon Musk’s aerospace company SpaceX has acquired his artificial intelligence business xAI, in a $1.25tn (£910bn) merger that consolidates part of Musk’s empire as SpaceX prepares to go public later this year.The two companies announced the deal on Monday in a statement on SpaceX’s website, saying the merger would form “the most ambitious, vertically-integrated innovation engine on (and off) Earth, with AI, rockets, space-based internet, direct-to-mobile device communications and the world’s foremost real-time information and free speech platform”. Continue reading...

items.title: What’s Musk Trying to Achieve With the SpaceX-xAI Deal?
items.standfirst: Elon Musk is combining SpaceX and xAI as he looks to fuel his increasingly costly ambitions in artificial intelligence and space exploration. The deal gives SpaceX a valuation of $1 trillion, and xAI a value of $250 billion, people familiar with the matter said. Bloomberg’s Neil Campling breaks down the possible reasoning behind the deal.
items.content: Elon Musk is combining SpaceX and xAI as he looks to fuel his increasingly costly ambitions in artificial intelligence and space exploration. The deal gives SpaceX a valuation of $1 trillion, and xAI a value of $250 billion, people familiar with the matter said. Bloomberg’s Neil Campling breaks down the possible reasoning behind the deal.

items.standfirst: By fusing SpaceX and xAI—which acquired X last year—Elon Musk tightens his grip over technologies that shape national security, social media, and artificial intelligence.

items.title: Oracle’s Huge Bond Sale, Musk Eyes SpaceX and xAI Combo | Bloomberg Tech 2/2/2026
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses Disney's earnings lifted by record results in its parks division. Plus, Oracle kicks off a massive bond sale as the software giant looks to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year through a combination of debt and equity sales to build additional cloud infrastructure capacity. And sources say Elon Musk is in advanced talks to combine SpaceX with xAI. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses Disney's earnings lifted by record results in its parks division. Plus, Oracle kicks off a massive bond sale as the software giant looks to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year through a combination of debt and equity sales to build additional cloud infrastructure capacity. And sources say Elon Musk is in advanced talks to combine SpaceX with xAI. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Elon Musk Said to Be Merging SpaceX and xAI Ahead of Mega IPO

items.content: Elon Musk plans to merge SpaceX with xAI, according to people familiar with the matter. The combined company would have a valuation of $1.25 trillion according to sources. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Musk Said to be in Advanced Talks to Combine SpaceX, xAI
items.standfirst: Elon Musk is in advanced talks to combine SpaceX with xAI, according to people familiar with the matter. Bloomberg’s Liana Baker discusses the possible consolidation of the billionaire’s empire with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.standfirst: Elon Musk is in advanced talks to combine Space Exploration Technologies Corp. with xAI, according to people familiar with the matter, underscoring how the billionaire’s artificial intelligence ambitions have grown too costly for any one of his entities to shoulder alone.
items.content: Elon Musk is in advanced talks to combine Space Exploration Technologies Corp. with xAI, according to people familiar with the matter, underscoring how the billionaire’s artificial intelligence ambitions have grown too costly for any one of his entities to shoulder alone.

items.title: Rape trial begins for son of Norway's crown princess in tense moment for royal family
items.standfirst: Marius Borg Høiby is accused of 38 charges including four counts of rape in one of the biggest cases in Norway for years.
items.content: Marius Borg Høiby is accused of 38 charges including four counts of rape in one of the biggest cases in Norway for years.

items.content: The eldest son of Norway's crown princess has been arrested over new criminal allegations ahead of a trial on charges including rape.

items.title: Son of Norway’s crown princess arrested on new charges before start of rape trial
items.standfirst: Detention of Marius Borg Høiby comes as Epstein files pile pressure on his mother, crown princess Mette-MaritThe son of Norway’s crown princess, Marius Borg Høiby, has been arrested on new charges just days before the start of his rape trial, as his mother continues to face questions over her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.The Oslo police district said Høiby had been arrested on Sunday evening on suspicion of assault, making threats with a knife and violating a restraining order. Continue reading...
items.content: Detention of Marius Borg Høiby comes as Epstein files pile pressure on his mother, crown princess Mette-MaritThe son of Norway’s crown princess, Marius Borg Høiby, has been arrested on new charges just days before the start of his rape trial, as his mother continues to face questions over her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.The Oslo police district said Høiby had been arrested on Sunday evening on suspicion of assault, making threats with a knife and violating a restraining order. Continue reading...

items.title: Norway’s royal crisis: Crown princess faces Epstein scrutiny ahead of son’s rape trial
items.standfirst: Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit is facing mounting scrutiny after her name appeared more than a thousand times in the latest batch of released documents related to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The revelations come as the princess’ son, Marius Borg Hoiby, faces 38 criminal charges, including rape, in a trial that is due to start Tuesday. Over the weekend, Hoiby was arrested again – this time on suspicion of threats, assault and for violating a restraining order, police said.
items.content: Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit is facing mounting scrutiny after her name appeared more than a thousand times in the latest batch of released documents related to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The revelations come as the princess’ son, Marius Borg Hoiby, faces 38 criminal charges, including rape, in a trial that is due to start Tuesday. Over the weekend, Hoiby was arrested again – this time on suspicion of threats, assault and for violating a restraining order, police said.

clusters.title: Live: Iran and US expected to resume nuclear talks in Turkey on Friday
clusters.neutral_headline: Iran’s president says Tehran ready to pursue ‘fair’ talks with US
bullet_summary: Iran and the US are expected to resume nuclear talks on Friday in Turkey, officials from both sides said Monday
Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said that he had instructed the country’s foreign minister to “pursue fair and equitable negotiations” with the US

items.title: Live: Iran and US expected to resume nuclear talks in Turkey on Friday
items.standfirst: Iran and the US are expected to resume nuclear talks on Friday in Turkey, officials from both sides said Monday. Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said that he had instructed the country’s foreign minister to “pursue fair and equitable negotiations” with the US. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.
items.content: Iran and the US are expected to resume nuclear talks on Friday in Turkey, officials from both sides said Monday. Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said that he had instructed the country’s foreign minister to “pursue fair and equitable negotiations” with the US. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

items.title: Iran’s president says Tehran ready to pursue ‘fair’ talks with US
items.standfirst: Masoud Pezeshkian instructs foreign minister to seek negotiations with US as Trump warns ‘bad things would happen’ if no solution agreedIran’s president said on Tuesday that he had instructed his foreign minister to “pursue fair and equitable negotiations” with the US, as the two countries reportedly prepared to send top envoys to Istanbul for high-stakes talks on the Iranian nuclear programme later this week.President Masoud Pezeshkian said in a post on X: “I have instructed my minister of foreign affairs, provided that a suitable environment exists – one free from threats and unreasonable expectations – to pursue fair and equitable negotiations, guided by the principles of dignity, prudence, and expediency.” Continue reading...
items.content: Masoud Pezeshkian instructs foreign minister to seek negotiations with US as Trump warns ‘bad things would happen’ if no solution agreedIran’s president said on Tuesday that he had instructed his foreign minister to “pursue fair and equitable negotiations” with the US, as the two countries reportedly prepared to send top envoys to Istanbul for high-stakes talks on the Iranian nuclear programme later this week.President Masoud Pezeshkian said in a post on X: “I have instructed my minister of foreign affairs, provided that a suitable environment exists – one free from threats and unreasonable expectations – to pursue fair and equitable negotiations, guided by the principles of dignity, prudence, and expediency.” Continue reading...

clusters.title: China to ban hidden car door handles on all EVs over crash safety concerns
clusters.neutral_headline: China to ban hidden car door handles on all EVs over crash safety concerns
bullet_summary: New rules, announced by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology on Monday, will take effect from January 1, 2027, and will require…
Reported by Guardian World, Reuters Top News, BBC World

items.title: China to ban hidden car door handles on all EVs over crash safety concerns
items.standfirst: Sleek car doors reduce vehicle drag but are prone to losing operability in the event of a crash, officials sayChina will soon ban concealed door handles on electric vehicles (EVs), becoming the first country to do so after several deadly incidents triggered global scrutiny of the controversial design first popularised by Tesla.According to regulations announced on Monday by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, cars sold in China will now be required to have a mechanical release on both the inside and outside of every door except the boot. Continue reading...
items.content: Sleek car doors reduce vehicle drag but are prone to losing operability in the event of a crash, officials sayChina will soon ban concealed door handles on electric vehicles (EVs), becoming the first country to do so after several deadly incidents triggered global scrutiny of the controversial design first popularised by Tesla.According to regulations announced on Monday by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, cars sold in China will now be required to have a mechanical release on both the inside and outside of every door except the boot. Continue reading...

New rules, announced by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology on Monday, will take effect from January 1, 2027, and will require…

items.title: The political fallout of the Epstein files
items.standfirst: After more than three million documents related to Jeffrey Epstein were released last Friday, tensions are growing across the globe. The disclosures have raised fresh questions about the convicted sex offender's relationships with the rich and powerful. Britain's former prince Andrew, his ex-wife Sarah Ferguson and career politician, Peter Mandelson, are among those who've been thrust back into the eye of the Jeffrey Epstein storm, after shocking, often intimate emails with the disgraced financier were released by the US Justice Department. Donald Trump, Elon Musk and Bill Gates were also mentioned in the tranche of three million documents. Sharon Gaffney spoke with Ian Reifowitz, distinguished professor at the State University of New York, about the latest on the fallout, and the reaction to the disclosures in the US.
items.content: After more than three million documents related to Jeffrey Epstein were released last Friday, tensions are growing across the globe. The disclosures have raised fresh questions about the convicted sex offender's relationships with the rich and powerful. Britain's former prince Andrew, his ex-wife Sarah Ferguson and career politician, Peter Mandelson, are among those who've been thrust back into the eye of the Jeffrey Epstein storm, after shocking, often intimate emails with the disgraced financier were released by the US Justice Department. Donald Trump, Elon Musk and Bill Gates were also mentioned in the tranche of three million documents. Sharon Gaffney spoke with Ian Reifowitz, distinguished professor at the State University of New York, about the latest on the fallout, and the reaction to the disclosures in the US.

clusters.title: France adopts delayed 2026 budget ending months of parliamentary deadlock
clusters.neutral_headline: France adopts 2026 budget after two no-confidence votes fail
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Al Jazeera, Guardian World

items.title: France adopts delayed 2026 budget ending months of parliamentary deadlock
items.standfirst: French prime minister Sébastien Lecornu has survived the last of a series of no-confidence votes, allowing the full 2026 budget to be adopted. The centurist prime minister had pushed the bill through parliament without a vote after securing the backing of the Socialist Party in exchange for some costly concessions. Also in the segment, US President Donald Trump says he will lower tariffs on Indian goods after New Delhi committed to ending its purchases of Russian oil.
items.content: French prime minister Sébastien Lecornu has survived the last of a series of no-confidence votes, allowing the full 2026 budget to be adopted. The centurist prime minister had pushed the bill through parliament without a vote after securing the backing of the Socialist Party in exchange for some costly concessions. Also in the segment, US President Donald Trump says he will lower tariffs on Indian goods after New Delhi committed to ending its purchases of Russian oil.

items.title: France adopts 2026 budget after two no-confidence votes fail
items.standfirst: New budget includes a $7.6m military spending increase and aims to cut the deficit to 5 percent by end of 2026.
items.content: New budget includes a $7.6m military spending increase and aims to cut the deficit to 5 percent by end of 2026.

items.title: Delayed French 2026 budget finally through, paves way for Macron’s military spending boost
items.standfirst: The long-awaited French budget for 2026 was finally adopted on Monday, after Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu had taken to a constitutional provision to force it through – then survived two no-confidence votes after doing so. The budget includes a major boost in French military spending, a move which President Emmanuel Macron has deemed necessary to enable France to sufficiently defend itself going forward.
items.content: The long-awaited French budget for 2026 was finally adopted on Monday, after Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu had taken to a constitutional provision to force it through – then survived two no-confidence votes after doing so. The budget includes a major boost in French military spending, a move which President Emmanuel Macron has deemed necessary to enable France to sufficiently defend itself going forward.

items.title: France passes budget after months of wrangling and no-confidence motions
items.standfirst: PM Sébastien Lecornu pushes budget through using constitutional powers that avoided vote in parliamentFrance has finally passed a budget for this year after the minority government survived a series of no-confidence votes in a long-running political saga that has unsettled debt markets and alarmed the country’s European partners.The prime minister, Sébastien Lecornu, told parliament on Monday, after months of wrangling, that French people “refuse this disorder and want our institutions to function”. Continue reading...
items.content: PM Sébastien Lecornu pushes budget through using constitutional powers that avoided vote in parliamentFrance has finally passed a budget for this year after the minority government survived a series of no-confidence votes in a long-running political saga that has unsettled debt markets and alarmed the country’s European partners.The prime minister, Sébastien Lecornu, told parliament on Monday, after months of wrangling, that French people “refuse this disorder and want our institutions to function”. Continue reading...

clusters.neutral_headline: Syrian forces deploy in Hasakah under ceasefire agreement with SDF
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Al Jazeera

items.title: Syria security forces enter strategic al-Hassakeh as part of deal with Kurdish-led SDF
items.standfirst: Forces reporting to Syria’s interior ministry on Monday entered the strategic city of al-Hassakeh in the northeast as part of an agreement with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). Under the deal, the security forces were given permission to enter two Kurdish-controlled cities in exchange for integrating SDF and its administration into the central government.
items.content: Forces reporting to Syria’s interior ministry on Monday entered the strategic city of al-Hassakeh in the northeast as part of an agreement with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). Under the deal, the security forces were given permission to enter two Kurdish-controlled cities in exchange for integrating SDF and its administration into the central government.

items.title: Syrian forces deploy in Hasakah under ceasefire agreement with SDF
